content.body: annevk: yes, 50 is the max length. After that adding new entries will cause old entries being dropped from the beginning.
content.formatted_body: annevk: yes, 50 is the max length. After that adding new entries will cause old entries being dropped from the beginning.

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: annevk: yes, 50 is the max length. After that adding new entries will cause old entries being dropped from the beginning.
annevk: yes, 50 is the max length. After that adding new entries will cause old entries being dropped from the beginning.

content.body: smaug: and history.length will continue to return 50? So wouldn't that mean that any kind of math on top of history.length is super fragile already?
content.formatted_body: smaug: and history.length will continue to return 50? So wouldn't that mean that any kind of math on top of history.length is super fragile already?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: smaug: and history.length will continue to return 50? So wouldn't that mean that any kind of math on top of history.length is super fragile already?
smaug: and history.length will continue to return 50? So wouldn't that mean that any kind of math on top of history.length is super fragile already?

content.body: yes
it is, but is that been that way for ages.  So I wouldn't be surprised if some site actually relies somehow on this behavior.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: it is, but is that been that way for ages.  So I wouldn't be surprised if some site actually relies somehow on this behavior.

content.body: But I guess very few sites rely on history.length in any way.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: But I guess very few sites rely on history.length in any way.

content.body: smaug: but how can you rely on it given that past visits will influence what it returns (and whether it returns something meaningful)
content.formatted_body: smaug: but how can you rely on it given that past visits will influence what it returns (and whether it returns something meaningful)

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: smaug: but how can you rely on it given that past visits will influence what it returns (and whether it returns something meaningful)
smaug: but how can you rely on it given that past visits will influence what it returns (and whether it returns something meaningful)

content.body: you may rely on it on a newly opened windows.  Or you may use it to check if there are web pages in history before your site
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: you may rely on it on a newly opened windows.  Or you may use it to check if there are web pages in history before your site

content.body: Either way, it does make me more concerned about dispose events when history.length === 50
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Either way, it does make me more concerned about dispose events when history.length === 50

content.body: smaug: yeah, so for those cases Nika's suggestion would work. For each new origin/site it's either 1 or 2 depending on whether there was a prior site (and maybe limit that to "in the same top-level browsing context" so you get 1 if you COOP).
content.formatted_body: smaug: yeah, so for those cases Nika's suggestion would work. For each new origin/site it's either 1 or 2 depending on whether there was a prior site (and maybe limit that to "in the same top-level browsing context" so you get 1 if you COOP).
